data.title: Thaioil has backup plan to end CFP project delays
data.description: Thaioil Plc is prepared to exercise its rights under a parent guarantee agreement with the main contractors of the US$5.37 billion Clean Fuel Project (CFP) to resolve persistent project delays.

data.title: Phuket gears up for high season
data.description: Phuket will welcome visitors from around the world with the Phuket Carnival at Patong 2024, an annual event which marks the beginning of the high tourism season on the island.

data.title: Energy key to push for digital hub plan
data.description: The state

data.title: Govt seeks answer on ship attack
data.description: The government has lodged a formal protest with the Myanmar government, after a fleet of Thai fishing boats were attacked off the waters of Ranong on Saturday.

data.title: Greater Bangkok to face thick smog from Monday to Friday
data.description: The Pollution Control Department is warning that people in Greater Bangkok will face thick smog from Monday to Friday due to smoke from farmland and stagnant air over the capital and nearby provinces.

data.title: Chinese man arrested at Bangkok airport over luxury used car fraud
data.description: Police captured a Chinese citizen who allegedly committed crimes related to luxury used cars at Suvarnabhumi Airport on Sunday as he was about to board a flight to Cambodia.

data.title: Body of missing Russian tourist found on Samui beach
data.description: SURAT THANI - A drowned Russian tourist has been found dead on Chaweng Beach on Koh Samui after she was swept into the sea on Friday.

data.title: Thailand seeks release of fishing crew, protests Myanmar attack on boats
data.description: Authorities are negotiating for the release of four Thai crew members arrested with a fishing boat towed to Myanmar and protesting against a gun attack on 15 fishing boats early Friday morning.

data.title: Special lane opens at Rama II Road collapse site outside Bangkok
data.description: SAMUT SAKHON: The Highways Department on Sunday opened a reversible lane to relieve outbound traffic on Rama II Road that was affected by the elevated road collapse from last Friday.

data.title: Flooding eases in Hat Yai but parts of southern Thailand still under water
data.description: Hat Yai, the economic hub in Thailand

data.title: Landslide hits southern Thailand's Betong
data.description: YALA: A landslide happened in Betong district in this southern border province on Sunday morning. No one was injured.

data.title: Israel warns citizens of terror threat in Southeast Asia with focus on Thailand
data.description: Israel warned its citizens that the threat of terrorism against them in Southeast Asia has intensified.

data.title: 'Influential ties' not a factor in land probe, says Narumon
data.description: Agriculture and Cooperatives Minister Narumon Pinyosinwat has vowed to take action against any encroachment of Sor Por Kor agricultural reform land by a romantic partner linked to a former deputy prime minister.

data.title: No good deed; polite thief strikes; body on roof saga
data.description: The owner of a BMW who pawned his vehicle in Nonthaburi has gone to police after the garage which helped arrange the financing refused to pay a repair bill when it was later involved in an accident.

data.title: Phuket to tackle food waste crisis
data.description: Phuket has introduced a food waste management initiative aimed at reducing waste by 15 tonnes daily as part of its effort to become a low-carbon destination.

data.title: Online gambling sites lure over 4m young Thais
data.description: More than four million young Thai people have been drawn into online gambling, which risks developing into an addiction that takes a toll on their health, according to experts.

data.title: Rama II motorway construction put on hold after fatal crane collapse
data.description: Transport Minister Suriya Jungrungreangkit has ordered work on a city motorway to be suspended for two weeks after Friday

data.title: Flood death toll rises to nine in South
data.description: SONGKHLA - The death toll from the worst floods in decades in southern Thailand climbed to nine on Saturday, as thousands of people were evacuated due to rising water levels.

data.title: 31 crew from Thai boats ‘taken into Myanmar’
data.description: More than 30 crew members of Thai  fishing boats  were detained in  Myanmar  waters on Saturday after three Myanmar patrol vessels opened fire on them, leaving one person dead and two injured, a navy commander said.

data.title: German woman bitten by fish in Phangnga
data.description: PHANGNGA - Authorities have issued a warning to tourists in Takua Pa district of this southern Thai province after a German tourist was bitten by an unidentified fish, leaving an oval-shaped wound approximately 20 centimetres long.
